articles.title: Long lines form outside of food banks ahead of the holiday
articles.description: CNN's Paul Vercammen reports from a Los Angeles food bank where long lines of those in need ahead of the holiday season shows the devastating economic impact of the Covid-19 pandemic.

articles.author: Kelsie Smith, CNN
articles.title: Sia defends casting a nondisabled actor to portray a person with autism in her upcoming film 'Music'
articles.description: Pop singer Sia is responding to the backlash to her upcoming film that has been criticized for casting a nondisabled actor to portray a character who has autism. And she's furious.

articles.author: Alaa Elassar and Sheena Jones, CNN
articles.title: Rival high schools cancel their annual 'Turkey Bowl' for first time in 100 years due to Covid-19
articles.description: For the past 100 years, two Baltimore County high school football teams have faced off every Thanksgiving morning.

articles.author: Lauren M. Johnson, CNN
articles.title: Make $2,500 to watch 25 movies in 25 days with this ideal holiday job
articles.description: It's every movie lover's dream to spend the season watching their favorite holiday films, but Reviews.org is going to pay someone to do just that.

articles.author: Ben Morse, CNN
articles.title: Tottenham Hotspur upset Manchester City to go top of Premier League
articles.description: Goals from Heung-min Son and Giovani Lo Celso helped Tottenham Hotspur surprise Manchester City 2-0 and move to the top of the Premier League table.

articles.author: Nathaniel Meyersohn, CNN Business
articles.title: As Black Friday approaches, retailers lobby states to stay open
articles.description: Retailers forced to close down stores to customers early in the pandemic are now pushing officials to allow them to stay open on Black Friday and into the holiday shopping season, even as coronavirus cases surge across the country.
articles.content: New York (CNN Business)Retailers forced to close down stores to customers early in the pandemic are now pushing officials to allow them to stay open on Black Friday and into the holiday shopping seas… [+5250 chars]

articles.author: Alaa Elassar, CNN
articles.title: An Iowa boy is selling baseball bats he makes from fallen trees to raise money for storm victims
articles.description: After a powerful wind storm struck Iowa in August, the city of Mount Vernon was left covered in fallen trees and other debris.

articles.author: Nima Elbagir, Katie Polglase, Gianluca Mezzofiore, Stephanie Busari and Jennifer Hansler, CNN
articles.title: Army says soldiers deployed at Lekki toll gate protests on October 20 were given both live and blank bullets, despite previous denials
articles.description: The Nigerian army admitted on Saturday that soldiers were given both live and blank bullets when they were deployed to protests at Lekki toll gate on October 20. The admission seems to confirm a key finding of a CNN investigation into the shooting.

articles.author: Brett Harman, CNN
articles.title: Must-watch videos of the week
articles.description: Diplomat becomes a hero. Buttered toast gets the internet fired up. Dogs get their own song. Here are the must-see videos of the week.

articles.author: Kevin Liptak, CNN
articles.title: Trump tweets about election results and skips session on pandemic during G20
articles.description: President Donald Trump participated in his final Group of 20 summit on Saturday by tweeting throughout the opening session and skipping a special side-conference focused on the coronavirus pandemic.

articles.author: Ben Morse, CNN
articles.title: Dominic Thiem edges Novak Djokovic in thriller to advance to final of ATP Finals
articles.description: Dominic Thiem needed two monster tie breaks to overcome Novak Djokovic and advance to the final of the ATP Finals, beating the Serbian 7-5, 6-7 (10-12), 7-6 (8-6) in a three-set thriller on Saturday.

articles.author: Analysis by Brian Stelter, CNN Business
articles.title: Analysis: Election denialism is a middle finger to democracy
articles.description: Why is there such demand for election denialism? Why are TV shows that claim President Trump is the rightful winner of the election garnering millions of viewers?

articles.author: Francesca Giuliani-Hoffman, CNN
articles.title: Her late daughter loved to sew, so she taught herself how to make masks and raised nearly $17,000 for the local food pantry
articles.description: For Sharon Hebert, the way to overcome the most difficult challenges is to focus on helping others, and she practices what she preaches.

articles.author: Rob Frehse and Sheena Jones, CNN
articles.title: Columbia University bans 70 students for Covid-19 travel violations
articles.description: Columbia University says it has temporarily banned at least 70 students for violating the New York City school's Covid-19 travel policy.

articles.title: Smerconish refutes Kaepernick call for convicted cop killer's release
articles.description: Colin Kaepernick is calling for the release of Mumia Abu-Jamal, serving a life sentence for killing a Philadelphia police officer in 1981. CNN's Michael Smerconish, who wrote a book about the case, weighs in.

articles.author: Dakin Andone, CNN
articles.title: Atlanta's mayor just appointed the city's first LGBTQ affairs director
articles.description: Atlanta Mayor Keisha Lance Bottoms has announced the city's first director of LGBTQ Affairs, her office said Friday.
articles.content:

articles.title: Bodies of rich man and slave discovered within Pompeii ruins

articles.author: Jordan Valinsky, CNN Business
articles.title: How to make your Thanksgiving meal for cheap or (practically) free
articles.description: From complicated Zoom setups to smaller gatherings, Thanksgiving dinner will look different for many families and friends this year.

articles.title: Donald Trump Jr. speaks after testing positive for Covid-19
articles.description: In a video posted to Instagram, Donald Trump Jr. confirmed he tested positive for Covid-19. The President's eldest son and said he was "totally asymptomatic" but would self-quarantine "out of an abundance of precaution."
